Package goldfish.model

Class Player

java.lang.Object
goldfish.model.Player
public class Player extends Object
The Player class represents a player in the game of chess

    • Player

      public Player(String color, King king, Queen queen, Rook[] rooks, Bishop[] bishops, Knight[] knights, Pawn[] pawns)
      Constructor for the player
      Parameters:
      color - the color of the player
      king - the king of the player
      queen - the queen of the player
      rooks - the rooks of the player
      bishops - the bishops of the player
      knights - the knights of the player
      pawns - the pawns of the player
      opponent - the opponent of the player

  • Method Details

    • getColor

      public String getColor()
      Get the color of the player
      Returns:
      "w" if the player is white, "b" if the player is black

    • getKing

      public King getKing()
      Return the player's king
      Returns:
      return the player's king

    • getQueen

      public Queen getQueen()
      Return the player's queen
      Returns:
      return the player's queen

    • getRooks

      public Rook[] getRooks()
      Return the player's rooks
      Returns:
      {Rook 1 (starts on a1), Rook 2 (starts on h1)}

    • getBishops

      public Bishop[] getBishops()
      Return the player's bishops
      Returns:
      {Bishop 1 (starts on c1), Bishop 2 (starts on f1)}

    • getKnights

      public Knight[] getKnights()
      Return the player's knights
      Returns:
      {Knight 1 (starts on b1), Knight 2 (starts on g1)}

    • getPawns

      public Pawn[] getPawns()
      Return the player's pawns
      Returns:
      {Pawn 1 (starts on a2), Pawn 2 (starts on b2), ..., Pawn 8 (starts on h2)}

    • getOpponent

      public Player getOpponent()
      Return the opponent of the player
      Returns:
      The White player if called on the Black player, and vice versa

    • setOpponent

      public void setOpponent(Player opponent)
      Set opponent
      Parameters:
      Player - The opponent of the player

    • isCheck

      public boolean isCheck()
      Check if the player is in check (if the opponent's pieces can attack the player's king)
      Returns:
      true if the player is in check, false otherwise

    • isCheckmate

      public boolean isCheckmate()
      Check if the player is in checkmate (if the player is in check and cannot move out of check)
      Returns:
      true if the player is in checkmate, false otherwise

    • isAttacking

      public boolean isAttacking(int x, int y)
      Check if the player is in stalemate (if the player is not in check and cannot move)
      Parameters:
      x - the x coordinate of the square to check
      y - the y coordinate of the square to check
      Returns:
      true if the player is in stalemate, false otherwise
